title: Remembering Princess Diana's most iconic fashion moments, 22 years after her untimely death
text:
Princess Diana is an icon of 20th century glamour; she was always aware of the power her wardrobe choices gave her to communicate key messages, whether she was 'revenge dressing' in an LBD or diplomatically representing the country on official state visits.

Anna Harvey was the Vogue fashion editor who helped Diana to create her look, transforming her from shy teen to elegant stateswoman.

‘The editors could see the danger of turning her into a fashion plate, and the criticism Vogue would get for that, and I think they thought the risk was less with somebody like me,' Harvey told The Telegraph in 2017.

‘I was unbelievably excited and nervous and terrified that people would say, “My God, why is she wearing that? Who helped her choose that?”’ she says of the first engagements Diana carried out wearing looks she had styled.

Diana's style still resonates today- The Telegraph's fashion news and features director Bethan Holt has a wardrobe inspired by her look from across the years.

Today, 22 years after she passed away, click through our gallery to remember some of Princess Diana's most iconic looks...
